trial_identification.studytitle: Cardiac function in women with preeclampsia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Left ventricular systolic and diastolic function and structure using transthoracic echocardiography in women with untreated preeclampsia compared to healthy pregannt women and non-pregnant women

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Fetal medicine and complications of pregnancy

interventions.interventions: Observations of cardiac function using transthoracic echocardiography at the time of the diagnosis of preeclampsia. Transthoracic echocardiography will also be perfomred in healthy pregnant women and in non-pregnant women. Transthoracic echocardiography examination will take approximately 15 minutes
interventions.comparator: Observations of cardiac function using transthoracic echocardiography in gestationally matched healthy pregnant women

primaryOutcome.outcome: systolic function assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of diagnosis of preeclampsia

primaryOutcome.outcome: diastolic function assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of diagnosis of preeclampsia

primaryOutcome.outcome: cardiac structure assessed by transthoracic echocardiography
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of diagnosis of preeclampsia

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: post birth data obtained from medical record
post birth data obtained from medical record
post birth data obtained from medical record
post birth data obtained from medical record
post birth data obtained from medical record

secondaryOutcome.outcome: neonatal admission to special care nurseryor neonatal intensive care unit
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: post birth data obtained from medical record
post birth data obtained from medical record

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: non-labouring women with a diagnosis of preeclampsia, non-smokers healthy pregnant women without diagnosis of preeclampsia healthy non-pregnant women
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: previous cardiac disease including hypertension, uterine abnormality, receiving vasoactive drugs

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: The Department of Pharmacology Level 8, Medical Building (No. 181) Corner of Grattan Street and Royal Parade University of Melbourne Victoria 3010 Australia

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Suite 603 Eastpoint Tower, 180 Ocean Steet, Edgecliffe, 2027, NSW

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine cardiac function in pregnant women at the time of the diagnosis of preeclampsia and before any treatment is commenced. The cardiac function at this time will be compared to healthy gestationally matched pregnant women and also to non-pregnant healthy women.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Mercy Hospital for Women Human Research and Ethics Committee
